programme.desc: Asking For It': survivor recounts the day she was raped and her fight for justice | He said: "I’d break the law for you." I was 13': calling time on street harassment

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: Brian was down on his luck and sleeping rough in Liverpool. Lawrence was a successful hotelier and property developer. David was a self-proclaimed hippy in a dead-end job. Together they formed an unlikely alliance and created a homeless shelter like no other. But can it last?

programme.title: Gender beyond the binary | the Christian volunteers doing police work in Reading
programme.desc: Gender beyond the binary | I'll ask God to intervene: the Christian volunteers doing police work in Reading

programme.title: Crossing the line
programme.desc: Episode one: Khaled's Ladder | Episode two: The story of Civil Rights is unfinished

programme.title: Black Enough?
programme.desc: From Burna Boy to Beyoncé: how black culture is embracing its African roots | Why the first US cowboys were black? | How 'Voodoo' became a metaphor for evil

programme.title: Meet the artists
programme.desc: Jane and Louise Wilson | Alex Katz

programme.title: The art of photography
programme.desc: Guardian Australia and photographers across various disciplines take us through their process.

programme.title: This is Europe - Baby Bust
programme.desc: Leah Green travels across Europe to find out why fewer babies are being born, and what it means for our future.

programme.title: Second innings
programme.desc: From Afghanistan to London, three boys build a new life playing cricket. Tucked away in suburban south London, matches take place every week for young and often traumatised asylum seekers.

programme.title: Sprinter Factory
programme.desc: These are the girls running as fast as they can to be Jamaica’s new sprint champions in a country obsessed with its athletes. This is the story of the Champs national youth athletics competition that could change their lives.

programme.title: What's it like to spar with Carl Froch? | It's my body of armour
programme.desc: What's it like to spar with Carl Froch? | It's my body of armour: my life as a female bodybuilder

programme.title: Could some birth-control methods kill you? | Life on Mars? Nasa's Hawaiian dome
programme.desc: Sweetening the pill: could some birth-control methods kill you? | The Hawaiian dome where Nasa prepares humanity for life on Mars

programme.title: Gay, black and HIV positive: America's hidden epidemic
programme.desc: If you are a black, gay man in America, your risk of contracting HIV is one in two. Leah Green travels to Atlanta, Georgia, which has the largest gay and black community in the country. She finds out how stigma, education and structural racism continue to feed into this startling statistic

programme.title: Somali Night Fever
programme.desc: In the 1970s and 80s Mogadishu's airwaves were filled with Somali funk, disco, soul and reggae.

programme.title: Ghosts of Moria: living in the ashes of Europe's largest migrant camp
programme.desc: As Europe’s most infamous migrant camp burned to the ground on the island of Lesbos in 2020, two Syrian friends evaded police to stay.

programme.title: Leonora Carrington: Britain's lost surrealist | Rembrandt's portraits at the National Gallery
programme.desc: Leonora Carrington: Britain's lost surrealist | Love and loss: Rembrandt's portraits at the National Gallery

programme.title: Fukushima: 'Nuclear power and humans cannot coexist' | Toll on Argentina's indigenous people
programme.desc: Fukushima: 'Nuclear power and humans cannot coexist' | How fracking is taking its toll on Argentina's indigenous people

programme.title: We swam to Hong Kong for freedom | The Chagos Islanders taking back their birthplace
programme.desc: We swam to Hong Kong for freedom half a century ago. What now?' | The Chagos Islanders taking back their birthplace from the British: 'They uprooted us'

programme.title: Skyward: birdwatching is belonging for two teenage conservationists
programme.desc: Young birdwatchers Mya and Arjun feel the pressure of climate breakdown and the biodiversity crisis. As two reserved teenagers on the cusp of adulthood, they find comfort in birdwatching while being distant from their peers.

programme.title: The golden poison dart frog | If you eat beef, don't wash
programme.desc: The golden poison dart frog: 'Like holding a loaded gun' | The solution to California's drought: if you eat beef, don't wash

programme.title: Inside Out: Indigenous imprisonment in Australia
programme.desc: Filmed on the plains of north-western New South Wales, this documentary looks at one man's fight against the scourge of Indigenous imprisonment in his community.

programme.title: Why is big tobacco booming? | Campaign to reclaim children's play space on British streets
programme.desc: We're quitting smoking, so why is big tobacco booming? | Kids v cars: the campaign to reclaim children's play space on British streets

programme.title: Fighting Shame
programme.desc: A group of women use everyday items to tell of the sacrifices and difficult choices they face, and the community initiatives they have launched in an attempt to tackle the shame surrounding poverty and make policymakers listen.

programme.title: Daisy Chain: Can a Cornish town adapt to survive another lockdown?
programme.desc: When the remote town of St Just, Cornwall, was locked down in March 2020, the small community worried that its economy wouldn't survive.

programme.title: Swipe my race | Conectifai | Muslim Americans on life after 9/11
programme.desc: Swipe my race: 'If you're only dating someone for their skin colour, you should consider why' | Conectifai | Muslim Americans on life after 9/11: 'The toll has been huge'

programme.title: Funeral poverty: one woman's battle to pay for her son's burial
programme.desc: One suddenly bereaved mother, already in debt, has to find thousands of pounds to pay for her son's funeral.

programme.title: YouTube kids: how unboxing, gaming and toy reviews took over
programme.desc: Being a YouTuber is now the most popular aspiration for children today, according to a survey. In 2018, the site’s highest earner was a seven-year-old American toy reviewer.

programme.title: Is algorave the future of dance music? | Wet plate collodion photography
programme.desc: Run the code: is algorave the future of dance music? | The black art: wet plate collodion photography

programme.title: The County - what happens after police kill someone you love?
programme.desc: When someone dies after an encounter with law enforcement, he leaves behind parents and children, loss and confusion. What’s to be done when those people sworn to protect you are the same people who pull the trigger?

programme.title: 2020: A Covid Space Odyssey
programme.desc: A short diary of astronaut Jessica Meir during her seven-month mission on the International Space Station (September 2019 - April 2020).

programme.title: The Hour of Lynching - vigilante violence in India
programme.desc: Rakbar, a Muslim dairy farmer, was murdered by a Hindu mob who thought he was taking a cow to be slaughtered for meat.

programme.title: From the Bronx to Yale: the power of high school 'speech'
programme.desc: High school students from Democracy Prep school in the South Bronx, New York, compete against young people across the US at a ‘speech’ competition at Yale University, a form of competitive acting.

programme.title: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore
programme.desc: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | 'I'll write as if I'm trying to get sacked': Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore

programme.title: Paris: where street basketball meets hip-hop | Mark Rothko murals at Tate Modern
programme.desc: Paris: where street basketball meets hip-hop | Waves of mysterious meaning: Mark Rothko murals at Tate Modern

programme.title: Meet the Birdians | Darwin's lost microscope
programme.desc: Australian bird of the year 2021: Meet the 'birdians' | Darwin's lost microscope: the auction of a history-making 'box of brass'

programme.title: World Cup Slaves
programme.desc: Nepalese men employed in Qatar's construction industry tell Robert Booth how they work for little or no pay as they build the infrastructure ahead of the 2022 football World Cup.

programme.title: The 'Lost Rambos' of Papua New Guinea: how weapons and Hollywood changed tribal disputes
programme.desc: Tribal fighting has long been present in the Papua New Guinea highlands but the influx of modern automatic weaponry in the 1990s turned local disputes into lethal exchanges that threatened to permanently reshape highlands culture.

programme.title: America's Dirty Divide
programme.desc: How heat is radically altering Americans' lives before they're even born | Baltimore is burning trash, so we're starving the fire

programme.title: Guardian Australia: My People
programme.desc: In the video series ‘My People’, Guardian Australia explores the peculiar subcultures and niche communities bringing people together across the country. With the breakdown of more traditional communities, these new groups of shared common interests are more important than ever.

programme.title: Crossing the line
programme.desc: 10 Middle Eastern artists undertake a road trip across the US, exploring common concerns between the US and the Middle East. Made in collaboration with Culturunners.

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - The artist and their city
programme.desc: The artist and their city: Abraham Cruzvillegas: 'Mexico City is about to collapse… yet it's optimistic' | The truth about Tehran, by artist Nazgol Ansarinia: 'It's building a fantasy future' | Artist Doris Salcedo on Bogotá: 'The forces at work here are brutal'

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Guardian Cities
programme.desc: Guardian Cities: Pyongyang calling: we spent a week in North Korea | Guardian Tokyo week: Looking for cheap rent? Try a haunted house

programme.title: On the Ground
programme.desc: The fall of Nagorno-Karabakh: 'I've lost a child, and now a homeland' | Into the wild to fight Scotland’s addiction problems

programme.title: The Pegasus project
programme.desc: A special investigation into NSO Group, which sells hacking spyware to governments.

programme.title: The Fight
programme.desc: People with disabilities are among the most discriminated against in Bolivia. Fed up with being ignored, a group of them march across the Andes to the seat of the government in La Paz, asking to speak to President Evo Morales. They are met with riot police, barricades, teargas and water cannon.

programme.title: Police Brutality: the families left behind | What does it mean to defund the police?
programme.desc: The families left behind after police killings: 'You never get over losing a child' | What does it mean to defund the police?

programme.title: The complex racial identity of a tiny Ohio town | Organising a rural UK Black Lives Matter protest
programme.desc: You don't have to look black to be black: The complex racial identity of a tiny Ohio town | I'm very aware I’m mixed race here: organising a rural UK Black Lives Matter protest

programme.title: Fight or flight: the veterans at war with PTSD
programme.desc: One hundred years on from the end of the first world war, a group of veterans in Dorset are torn between their pride in their military careers and their anger over the lack of psychological support provided to them by the Ministry of Defence.

programme.title: 7 October attack one year on: Inside an Israeli kibbutz terrorised by Hamas
programme.desc: Before Hamas’s rampage through southern Israel on 7 October, the kibbutz of Nir Oz was home to 400 people. It was a lively community that had historically enjoyed good relationships with the population in neighbouring Gaza.

programme.title: The secret world of Asian drag queens | Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy'
programme.desc: Getting rid of the beard is a challenge: the secret world of Asian drag queens | Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy'

programme.title: Should we abolish private schools? | The Afghan girls fighting to go to school
programme.desc: Should we abolish private schools? | Banned by the Taliban: the Afghan girls fighting to go to school

programme.title: A seven-year-old’s life in Gaza | The Ukrainian family reunited for Christmas
programme.desc: How I survive: a seven-year-old’s life in Gaza | ‘It feels like a miracle’: the Ukrainian family reunited for Christmas

programme.title: "I want to bring up a warrior": Ukraine's far-right children's camp
programme.desc: In Ukraine, the far-right Azov militia is fighting on the frontline – and running a summer camp for children.

programme.title: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley
programme.desc: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley: a Native American family's desperate search for their missing relative

programme.title: Italian mafia’s cocaine trafficking leaves trail of drug devastation among poor of Brazil
programme.desc: The all-powerful Calabrian crime syndicate 'Ndrangheta has forged a deadly network of drug trafficking routes through Brazil – 80% of all cocaine arriving in Europe comes through the country's Santos port.

programme.title: I came out as HIV positive to break down stigma | Staged Sex: Role of the Intimacy Co-Ordinator

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTN's brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the world's most powerful laser and the world's smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occam's Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already "living in the future"!

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.desc: W Chorwacji można spotkać jedne z największych karpi na świecie — i jest ich całe mnóstwo! Nie ma lepszego miejsca do łowienia karpi niż jezioro Zajarki na obrzeżach Zagrzebia.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep7
programme.desc: W Arkansas dochodzi do zawalenia się mostu na autostradzie. W Wielkiej Brytanii Królewskie Siły Powietrzne starają się ratować rozpadającą się tamę... i położone poniżej niej miasto.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep3
programme.desc: W Dakocie Północnej wykolejony pociąg o mały włos nie niszczy miasta. W Kanadzie rutynowy remont mostu nie przebiega zgodnie z planem. Most w porcie na Tajwanie w ciągu kilku sekund znika w wodzie.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Will i Gus znajdują roadstera audi quattro, ale samochód jest w kiepskim stanie: rozkładany dach nie działa, odpada rura wydechowa. Takie auto po prostu trzeba kupić!

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Will i Gus znajdują pomarańczowego relianta kittena. Samochód jest w złym stanie: karoseria jest oddzielona od podwozia, silnik nie działa — ale ekipa jest przekonana, że da się na nim zarobić.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Will i Gus chcą kupić roadstera MGB, ale znajdują tylko tańszą wersję GT. Kiedy samochód trafia do warsztatu, szybko okazuje się, że jest w gorszym stanie, niż się wydawało.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Will i Gus chcą kupić legendarnego volkswagena garbusa, ale ceny na rynku okazują się zbyt wysokie. W końcu znajdują sprzedawcę: auto jest w doskonałym stanie jak na cenę poniżej 1000 funtów.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Will i Gus chcą kupić morrisa minora: jest wielu chętnych na ten klasyczny samochód. Udaje im się kupić egzemplarz na internetowej aukcji, ale szybko okazuje się, że niełatwo będzie na nim zarobić.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep3
programme.desc: W Dakocie Północnej wykolejony pociąg o mały włos nie niszczy miasta. W Kanadzie rutynowy remont mostu nie przebiega zgodnie z planem. Most w porcie na Tajwanie w ciągu kilku sekund znika w wodzie.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep4
programme.desc: W Kanadzie, w zatłoczonym centrum handlowym dochodzi do tragedii. W Missouri ogromna zapora na szczycie góry rozpada się w kilka minut. W Melbourne pożar trawi wieżowiec.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep5
programme.desc: Wybuch w rafinerii w Teksasie sieje wielkie spustoszenie. Powódź w Iowa niszczy ważny przejazd kolejowy. W Australii błąd w projekcie zmusza do przebudowy jednej z największych atrakcji turystycznych.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep6
programme.desc: W Nowym Orleanie dochodzi do tragedii przy budowie hotelu. Na kampusie w Karolinie Północnej zawala się most.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep7
programme.desc: W Arkansas dochodzi do zawalenia się mostu na autostradzie. W Wielkiej Brytanii Królewskie Siły Powietrzne starają się ratować rozpadającą się tamę... i położone poniżej niej miasto.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Transport drewna wartego milion dolarów może utknąć w drodze — chyba że Craig wymyśli jakiś plan; tymczasem w dolinie Brent ma wielotygodniowe zaległości w pracy.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Gloverowie ścigają się z czasem, ściągając drewno i maszyny z Erie Mountain. Ekipa Craiga także ma coraz mniej czasu; Craig jest przekonany, że używana maszyna, którą właśnie kupił, zapewni mu sukces.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Craig LeBeau i jego ekipa rozbijają obóz w odległej części Shuswap Highlands. Tymczasem Brent oczyszcza drogę dla skuterów śnieżnych na zlecenie lokalnego ośrodka narciarskiego.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Napięcie rośnie, kiedy Craig i Taylor próbują przenieść 65-tonową wyciągarkę. Gloverowie zmieniają miejsce na górze Erie Mountain w regionie Salmo.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Craig i jego ekipa ratunkowa wycinają spalony fragment lasu na północ od Kamloops, ale niebezpieczna mieszanka popiołu i wody deszczowej fatalnie wpływa na maszyny i załogę.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Awaria na wielką skalę
programme.desc: Michael i Cherie z Diehard udają się na swoją zaniedbaną działkę, aby spróbować szczęścia. Stara wiertnica Raya i Paula ma uszkodzony silnik — jedyną opcją pozostaje wymiana.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Michael i Cherie są zdeterminowani, aby jak najlepiej wykorzystać swoją działkę, dopóki warunki są dobre. Ray i Paul schodzą pod ziemię w nadziei na znalezienie zielonego szafiru.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Światełko na końcu tunelu
programme.desc: Anthony i Jodie w końcu instalują drabinę w swoim nieużywanym szybie. Matt i Amber zaczynają kopać pod ziemią na swojej nowej działce; czy ich inwestycja się opłaci, czy może zmarnowali pieniądze?

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S1 Ep1
programme.desc: W legendarnym rejonie Goldfields w Australii Zachodniej trzy grupy poszukiwaczy złota stawiają wszystko na jedną kartę w nadziei na znalezienie dużej ilości cennego kruszcu.

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S1 Ep2
programme.desc: Awarie maszyn i rosnąca presja związana z wysoką stawką sprawiają, że dla dwóch grup poszukiwaczy zapowiada się bardzo trudny sezon.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep3
programme.desc: W Dakocie Północnej wykolejony pociąg o mały włos nie niszczy miasta. W Kanadzie rutynowy remont mostu nie przebiega zgodnie z planem. Most w porcie na Tajwanie w ciągu kilku sekund znika w wodzie.
